occurrences.text: to, again, you can jot down the verses, but if you were to go back to Proverbs chapter 7, and verse number 10 specifically, the Bible speaks about the attire of an harlot, okay? Now you say, man, pastor, that's strong language, that's the Bible, it's the words that are used in Proverbs 7 and verse number 10, and why do I bring that up this morning? Well, because there was attire that was communicating something to those that were in that society. What was the attire communicating? That they were an harlot. That's why the attire is referred to as the attire of an harlot, okay? Now I would argue this morning that in our 2024, as we look at what's taking place in our world today, that probably what God is referring to in Proverbs 7 and verse number 10 was actually a whole lot modest, more modest than a lot of things that are available today. I understand the difficulties, I have a wife and two daughters, I understand the difficulties, but we must acknowledge this morning the fact that God has given us instruction. I want to remind you that in Genesis chapter 38 and verses 14 and 15, what Tamar did was changed her garments and her appearance, and you can read of what takes place with Judah and Tamar, and Judah says, can I come in unto thee? Why?

occurrences.sermon_title: "Behavior In God's Church - Part One" I Timothy 2:9-15
